qas.question: How far back could these recording practices be traced?
What were the recording standards based off from?
What became the predecessor to the RIAA curve?
Who developed the New Orthophonic curve?
Whom wrote the publication outlining the New Orthophonic curve?

context: Ultimately, the <a2_0>New Orthophonic curve<a2_0/> was disclosed in a publication by <a4_0>R.C. Moyer<a4_0/> of <a3_0>RCA Victor<a3_0/> in 1953. He traced RCA Victor characteristics back to the Western Electric "rubber line" recorder in <a0_0>1925<a0_0/> up to the early 1950s laying claim to <a1_0>long-held recording practices<a1_0/> and reasons for major changes in the intervening years. The RCA Victor New Orthophonic curve was within the tolerances for the NAB/NARTB, Columbia LP, and AES curves. It eventually became the technical predecessor to the RIAA curve.
